intro: Berria, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. Berria species typically grow in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
